pr_title: Fix un-prefixed xml import bad-sad error

timeline.message: Fix un-prefixed xml import bad-sad error

timeline.author: pubudu91

timeline.body: I'm assuming the above logic is for constants of the form `"{http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace}space"`? If so, is it a possibility to have multiple braces within such a string? In that case, would the result produced by this logic still be correct?
timeline.bodyText: I'm assuming the above logic is for constants of the form "{http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace}space"? If so, is it a possibility to have multiple braces within such a string? In that case, would the result produced by this logic still be correct?
timeline.bodyHTML: I'm assuming the above logic is for constants of the form "{http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace}space"? If so, is it a possibility to have multiple braces within such a string? In that case, would the result produced by this logic still be correct?
timeline.author: pubudu91

replies.bodyText: Yey, it's URI, not an HTTP URL
replies.author: rdhananjaya

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
dlog.error(pos, DiagnosticCode.INCOMPATIBLE_TYPES,
symTable.stringType, constantSymbol.literalType);
dlog.error(pos, DiagnosticCode.INCOMPATIBLE_TYPES, symTable.stringType, constantSymbol.literalType);
timeline.author: MaryamZi

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (xmlnsSymbol != null && xmlnsSymbol.getKind() == SymbolKind.XMLNS) {
bLangXMLQName.namespaceURI = ((BXMLNSSymbol) xmlnsSymbol).namespaceURI;
bLangXMLQName.nsSymbol = (BXMLNSSymbol) xmlnsSymbol;
} else {
resultType = symTable.semanticError;
return;
}
if (xmlnsSymbol == null || xmlnsSymbol.getKind() != SymbolKind.XMLNS) {
resultType = symTable.semanticError;
return;
}
BXMLNSSymbol symbol = (BXMLNSSymbol) xmlnsSymbol;
bLangXMLQName.namespaceURI = symbol.namespaceURI;
bLangXMLQName.nsSymbol = symbol;
timeline.author: MaryamZi

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
xmlnsSymbol = new BXMLNSSymbol(names.fromString(constVal.substring(e)), nsURI,
constantSymbol.pkgID, constantSymbol.owner);
pkgSymbol.isUsed = true;
return xmlnsSymbol;
pkgSymbol.isUsed = true;
return new BXMLNSSymbol(names.fromString(constVal.substring(e)), nsURI,
constantSymbol.pkgID, constantSymbol.owner);
timeline.author: MaryamZi

timeline.body: Do we need to set `resultType` here? Ideally should be done where called right?
timeline.bodyText: Do we need to set resultType here? Ideally should be done where called right?
timeline.bodyHTML: Do we need to set resultType here? Ideally should be done where called right?
timeline.author: MaryamZi
